title:PandaPaxxy MKB PvE - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.

// Something New
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I recently broke out my Something New from last season with Headstone / Wellspring which is a shame we cannot get that roll this year. The closest is a heavier investment into grenades with Demolitionist. While not the worst weapon, losing Wellspring puts this behind Eyasluna for me, yes even without the origin trait." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=586671776&perks=106909392,124408337,1840239774,3523296417

// Compass Rose
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I've always liked the wombo combo of Grave Robber / Melee perk. One-Two Punch is usually my go-to but in precision and aggressives where the base damage is higher I flip flop between One-Two Punch and Trench Barrel. It switches up the order of operations which is sometimes too much for me. But it's always a nice synergy weapon to keep in your vault." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4169225313&perks=1300023272,1631667848,2360754333,791862061

// Crowning Doulogue
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Reconstruction and Reverberation don't seem like a pair. But with Reverberation your second shot (thanks to Reconstruction) has a larger blast radius size. I don't believe it adds to the actual blast radius stat, moreso just increases the radius upon getting kills. The intrinsic tracking will make using a rocket for add clear could be feasible." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4106757302&perks=1523832109,3525010810,3796465595,563069569

// Fortunate Star
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A lightweight bow with the Void wombo combo. What more could you want?" Recommended MW - Accuracy.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2326578623&perks=2048641572,2801223209,3429800428,776531651

// Bold Endings
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The first in a nice long list of new weapons is Bold Endings. A newish archetype being the heavy burst archetype, only occupied by Warden's Law. Bold Endings has the unique combination of Headstone and Dragonfly to immediately blow up those crystals. Great for add clear. Other solid options include Rapid Hit for reload speed and a tighter burst at max stacks, Strategist for immediate stability on class ability usage, and getting your class ability faster. Alongside Desperate Measures for great damage. Headstone with a damage perk or more AoE is probably going to be the play." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Call
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Arguably the best weapon in this DLC, The Call is only the second Rocket-Assisted Frame. The benefit is that The Call is craftable. If you never got your toes into Warlord's Ruin or haven't gotten a good drop, The Call allows you to mix and match. Lead from Gold or Subsistence are going to allow you to use The Call more like a primary weapon, paired with Hatchling for Strand synergy. One for All is not only the best damage perk in slot, it is incredibly easy to proc with the AoE from the rocket shots." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Axial Lacuna
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I enjoy the sights on this fusion, does that make it the best? Not really. There's a lot of good options in PvE; Reconstruction, Keep Away, and even Demolitionist are all good in slot. Controlled Burst with Reconstruction will be the best for pure damage. Opt for Incandescent and instead you've got a great room clearing weapon. Incandescent Vs Reservoir Burst is a discussion for another time." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Embraced Identity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Maybe not the best sniper in the game for damage. Being craftable makes the barrier for entry into getting those great snipers easier. Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds and Fourth time's the Charm allow you to fire for what feels like forever. The Supremacy can roll something similar and it can shoot for over 50 shots. Precision Instrument gives you some great damage over your larger mag but isn't the same instant bonus like Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Not the worst weapon to craft even if you do have your tried and true DPS weapon." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// No Hesitation
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Rooty tooty gun go ... Healy? Our very first legendary support weapon. Subsistence and Incandescent will allow you to build up charges while still being able to clear rooms with ease. Leaning more into support you have new perks Physic and Circle of Life. One giving you better healing, while the latter giving you bonus damage after healing allies. Depending on how you expect to use No Hesitations combinations of those four perks could be very strong. Leaning more into healing your team, explosions, doing better damage, EXPLOSIONS. The choice is yours." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

Reverberation is neat but doesn't do a lot. Personally I'd use Unrelenting to get passive health back as I'm focusing on other enemies while Lost Signal and the Radiolaria Transposer take care of any wave of enemies." // Veiled Threat
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Vex Mythoclast at home™. This auto does pretty well at staying competitive with the likes of Headstone and the new origin trait for.clearing waves of enemies. Being another Rapid-Fire stasis auto competes with the Krait collecting dust in your vault. The difference is Veiled Threat is craftable so if you never grabbed a good Krait when it was dropping during Witch Queen or from Banshee then this auto will suffice. // Corrasion
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Bungie beefing up some of these less populated archetypes. Our first / second legendary heavy burst pulse rifle comes with the Echoes. Unfortunately the Corrasion has no good reload perk outside of Perpetual Motion. The other stats are nice but I'm not always in motion to take advantage of it. High-Impact Reserves in the third column is interesting to beef up some damage at the end of your magazine but it doesn't do anything to aid us in getting to the next one. Frenzy does bump up handling and reload if you opt for that and will bump up your damage on top of High-Impact Reserves. Voltshot is a great room clearing perk but without a reload perk it's less desirable." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Faith-Keeper
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There's not a lot to say about this rocket, it’s a void rocket that allows for intrinsic tracking. This will be a great replacement for Bad Omens some of you have in your vaults. Explosive Light maxes out blast radius and gives a sizable damage bonus allowing you to invest into velocity to help that tracking. Auto-Loading Holster makes this rocket a “fire and forget.” Bipod and Clown Cartridge both allow you to overflow the magazine from 1 to potentially 3 or 4. Field Prep allows for the best “blow your load” and Reverberation can increase your explosion size for maximum add clear." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Ill Omen
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A caster frame sword with Cold Steel? All 3 Icefall Mantle Titan’s rejoice! This allows you to stun champs from further away or just synergize with Stasis. What separates this from The Slammer or Zephyr is really just being a caster frame. Unrelenting is going to allow you to throw your heavy attack into a group of enemies, focus on another separate target and still get your health back. Tireless Blades or Relentless Strikes will give you back ammo depending on what you’re looking to do, boss damage or add clear." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Line in the Sand
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "One of the beloved weapons from Season of the Dawn is Line in the Sand. Rapid Hit or Clown Cartridge are your best bets in column 3 with a specific niche using Deconstruction. Firing Line is the easiest damage bonus to activate but doesn’t work in small fireteams or solo, that’s where Bait and Switch or the new to linear fusions Reservoir Burst comes in. Ionized Battery, Clown Cartridge and Reservoir Burst bring the magazine up to 11 (normally 7) allowing 5 continuous Reservoir Burst shots. While Voltshot is present on this fusion I didn’t find it as useful compared to a primary or special weapon." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Speleologist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Rapid-Fire machine guns are an interesting time.They’re not incredibly strong for add clear but they are superb at damage. Speleologist has Envious Assassin for overflowing the magazine based on kills, and Killing Tally to really ramp up the damage, but it will never overthrow the king of machine gun DPS, Retrofit Escapade. Incandescent will clear rooms easier and your choice of Stats for All or Enlightened Action will increase the weapon feel. The Musketeer build of Stats and One for All is fun and synergizes well but on a heavy weapon I find it lacking." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Controlling Vision
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "It’s interesting this was the Dead Orbit weapon to be brought back to us. Controlling Vision is nowhere near the same levels as Heliocentric. Osmosis and Slideways are not good PvE perks but the alternative is Surplus or…Surrounded? Surrounded is good on a sidearm as you’re going to be in CQC 100% of the time, but Surplus in this economy is just underwhelming. I want to use my abilities, not hold onto them to bump up my sidearm." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Ded Gramarye IV
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A sleeper of a weapon this shotgun gets both Chain Reaction and Discord allowing for maximum carnage with a single weapon kill. Any weapon kill then swapping to Ded Gramarye IV will give you 8 seconds of infinite shots that explode enemies. What more could you ask for? Voltshot is another great perk as shotguns naturally load one bullet at a time so you can shoot once, reload that once and your next shot will apply all that Jolting goodness. This can be done indefinitely as long as you have ammo. I think on Arc and even neutral builds this might become one of the top picks, the issue is getting one to drop." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Maahes HC4 is another Heavy Burst hand cannon. Omolon Fluid Dynamics gives you a considerable amount of stability at the top half of the magazine. Unrelenting and Dragonfly or Golden Tricorn will be really good together as you get health back and have AoE explosions or increased damage to make the next enemy die that much quicker." // Better Devils
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Better Devils returns to us in a different form, Strand. Does this increase its viability? Not entirely. //notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Our second only lightweight auto rifle behind a blue rare version. Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds are both great options for Void builds. Enlightened Action brings up your already decent handling and reload speed just for shooting and hitting targets. // Shadow Price
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Shadow Price returns to us, is it better than before? Depends on what you’re looking to do. Overflow is the best option in column 3 but has no synergy with the best perk in column 4. Voltshot requires reloads to work and Overflow bypasses and does not allow you to reload when the magazine is larger than normal. Strategist works better for Voltshot but does not reload your weapon faster. Permeability works with Strategist as both use your class ability as activation points. One for All is the only good damage perk in the fourth column." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Shayura's Wrath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "My beloved Shayura’s Wrath comes back to us this season with a slight downgrade in the magazine department losing Accurized Rounds for Ricochet Rounds or High-Caliber Rounds. Cascade Point is funny to see but a bit more niche, Keep Away for the passive reload bonus and Strategist for class ability energy are both solid. Target Lock on SMGs was nerfed but in PvE still remains a solid option." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Shayura's Wrath (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "My beloved Shayura’s Wrath comes back to us this season with a slight downgrade in the magazine department losing Accurized Rounds for Ricochet Rounds or High-Caliber Rounds. Cascade Point is funny to see but a bit more niche, Keep Away for the passive reload bonus and Strategist for class ability energy are both solid. Target Lock on SMGs was nerfed but in PvE still remains a solid option." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Critical Anomaly
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Critical Anomaly has one of the most interesting perks we have seen on a sniper rifle. Chill Clip  allows you to stun 2/3 champions with one weapon and this season’s Radiant Orbs brings in the third allowing you to take care of all three champions with one weapon. Outside of the champion situation you have Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction for ammo and Bait and Switch or Firing Line for damage. Another interesting combination is either Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction with Triple Tap for a harder hitting Supremacy with less shots." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Forthcoming Deviance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Boy do I dislike testing Glaives. Forthcoming Deviance wasn’t too bad though. Reconstruction made it pretty easy to move from encounter to encounter while keeping damage up via Chaos Reshaped. Chain Reaction is probably going to be easier to use as you don’t need anything to activate it, while Destabilizing Rounds works better when on a Void subclass." Recommended MW: Shield Duration.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Non-Denouement
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "No arguments here, this is the best weapon from the Salvation’s Edge raid. Non-Denouement, while hard to spell, gives us something we haven’t seen before; Dragonfly and Voltshot together. Dragonfly allows you to get some AoE damage on the initial kill while Voltshot on a bow will make it so as long as you’re getting kills you’ll be able to jolt on the next shot. Dealing AoE damage on top of more AoE damage and jolt is just hilariously fun and gives Trinity Ghoul vibes without the cost of your exotic. You cannot hold onto the Voltshot shot like Trinity Ghoul but that alone separates this legendary from the exotic." Recommended MW: Accuracy, or Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Non-Denouement (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "No arguments here, this is the best weapon from the Salvation’s Edge raid. Non-Denouement, while hard to spell, gives us something we haven’t seen before; Dragonfly and Voltshot together. Dragonfly allows you to get some AoE damage on the initial kill while Voltshot on a bow will make it so as long as you’re getting kills you’ll be able to jolt on the next shot. Dealing AoE damage on top of more AoE damage and jolt is just hilariously fun and gives Trinity Ghoul vibes without the cost of your exotic. You cannot hold onto the Voltshot shot like Trinity Ghoul but that alone separates this legendary from the exotic." Recommended MW: Accuracy, or Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Nullify
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Nullify will not break the meta but instead slide itself comfortably towards the top. Heal Clip and Incandescent are tried and true options you’ll be seeing a lot of but an alternative healing / damage combo will be Subsistence with Chaos Reshaped. This allows you to bypass reload entirely while still getting damage and healing. Firefly will be a great alternative if you want some explosions / better reload instead of Subsistence." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

This allows you to bypass reload entirely while still getting damage and healing. Firefly will be a great alternative if you want some explosions / better reload instead of Subsistence." // Summum Bonum
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Summum Bonum is our first legendary wave frame sword. While being unique is it good? Well Unrelenting and Chain Reaction are both solid for keeping yourself alive while also clearing rooms with ease. If you wanted better health regeneration you could opt for Unrelenting and Chaos Reshaped. Both give healing at their full potential. Bait and Switch will give you the best damage while paired with either Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes for ammo regeneration." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Forbearance
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "While I, personally, am glad Forbearance is easier to get, I also understand why there's community hesitation against it. If you already have a Forbearance crafted or Adept, you definitely do not need to grind out the new version other than for progress towards Superblack. If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi’s Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Edge Transit
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hammerhead
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your “damage” perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Whisper of the Worm
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Whisper is back and craftable. What seems to be the best perks for our dear friend Xol, Will of Thousands? Arrowhead Brake is the best in slot for making the recoil direction vertical, but if you don't need that, Corkscrew Rifling or Fluted Barrel for the added stats. Bungie decided against magazine extending perks so the best here is Flared Magwell for when you miss and need to reload. Alloy Mag is great if you do run out of ammo and need to reload before another boss fight or after a wipe. In the third column Field Prep brings up the already buffed reserves while also making reloading faster when crouched. The final column are the stocks and Short-Action Stock is the best for the added handling, if you didn't slot in Arrowhead Brake and still want the recoil direction bumped up you could instead go for Fitted Stock."|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Blast Furnace
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Blast Furnace is probably the best feeling 450 aggressive frame pulse. // Elsie's Rifle
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Elsie's Rifle is a throwback to D1, and another good weapon Bungie could have brought back was Murmur, the element switching fusion *from the Moon.* Jokes aside, Elsie's Rifle is incredible. Rewind Rounds or Feeding Frenzy paired with Desperate Measures or Desperado, any combination of the above will be more than lethal. Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more “on demand” perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Succession
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I understand Bungie wants players to get a taste of the raid weapons to get players to buy the expansions and then play the raids, but Heritage is arguably a better Deep Stone Crypt weapon that doesn't infringe on other weapon types. Nevertheless, there are not many rolls you will be farming for. Reconstruction will give you more ammo in your magazine by rebuilding itself over time. Pair that with either Vorpal Weapon or Recombination for some high damage shot(s). Firing Line is great if you can link up with teammates to get the extra damage." Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Outbreak Perfected
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I remember the OG quest for Outbreak Prime. What a fun time. Outbreak Perfected has truly been perfected with crafting. Arrowhead Brake does improve the recoil but Outbreak Perfected has “auto rifle” recoil making the bounce a lot less intense. Bumping up the magazine with Appended Mag or Tactical Mag is preferred for more shots, but Flared Magwell for a bump in stability and reload will also feel nice. Rewind Rounds is the best perk in slot especially if the nanites count towards the bullets back. Rapid Hit or Outlaw are also great for just adding stability and reload. Short-Action Stock brings up the handling."|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Forbearance (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "While I, personally, am glad Forbearance is easier to get, I also understand why there's community hesitation against it. If you already have a Forbearance crafted or Adept, you definitely do not need to grind out the new version other than for progress towards Superblack. If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi’s Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Edge Transit (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hammerhead (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your “damage” perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Elsie's Rifle (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Elsie's Rifle is a throwback to D1, and another good weapon Bungie could have brought back was Murmur, the element switching fusion *from the Moon.* Jokes aside, Elsie's Rifle is incredible. Rewind Rounds or Feeding Frenzy paired with Desperate Measures or Desperado, any combination of the above will be more than lethal. Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more “on demand” perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Succession (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I understand Bungie wants players to get a taste of the raid weapons to get players to buy the expansions and then play the raids, but Heritage is arguably a better Deep Stone Crypt weapon that doesn't infringe on other weapon types. Nevertheless, there are not many rolls you will be farming for. Reconstruction will give you more ammo in your magazine by rebuilding itself over time. Pair that with either Vorpal Weapon or Recombination for some high damage shot(s). Firing Line is great if you can link up with teammates to get the extra damage." Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Darkest Before
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Darkest Before is now changed up and swapped to solar. With this change it synergizes better with solar subclass verbs. Heal Clip and Incandescent are fantastic together and allow you to push out your engagement ranges a bit further because it’s a pulse rifle. The issue I have with this is that Darkest Before is a rapid-fire frame, meaning it does really low damage per shot. Sometimes needing two or even three bursts for a red bar. Almost any other frame would be incredible. What a shame." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Relentless
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Relentless could overthrow Messenger for being the best legendary high-impact pulse in the game. Is it definitively better? No, nothing really is in this game. But it can compete for sure. Rapid Hit and Desperado are both great perks. Relentless being Strand allows it Slice and Hatchling that Messenger cannot get. Frenzy and Keep Away are both neutral perks that could do well with just about any combination of alternate perks." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Wild Style
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won’t even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you’re looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you’re committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Wild Style (Adept)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won’t even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you’re looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you’re committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. You can opt for a Heal Clip roll to keep yourself alive, a Target Lock roll to take down champions and larger health enemies, or even an Onslaught roll to tear into waves of adds with the damage of an auto but the speed of an SMG. Take your pick. If you’re going Heal Clip I would recommend Incandescent. Target Lock will work best with Overflow and Onslaught with Subsistence. You can mix and match to your heart’s content, but those are my recommendations." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. You can opt for a Heal Clip roll to keep yourself alive, a Target Lock roll to take down champions and larger health enemies, or even an Onslaught roll to tear into waves of adds with the damage of an auto but the speed of an SMG. Take your pick. If you’re going Heal Clip I would recommend Incandescent. Target Lock will work best with Overflow and Onslaught with Subsistence. You can mix and match to your heart’s content, but those are my recommendations." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// The Prophet
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "New DMT-lite? Heck yeah. Let’s Yee to the Haw. Keep Away will benefit your accuracy and reload speed which will help alleviate the necessity of reloader gauntlets. Do I recommend foregoing it entirely? No but you can stack enough reload through your masterwork, Keep Away, and Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to not need it. Precision Instrument will be great as the reload will allow you to keep up high stacks. Headstone works will being a scout and a high-damage frame." // The Prophet (Adept)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "New DMT-lite? Heck yeah. Let’s Yee to the Haw. Keep Away will benefit your accuracy and reload speed which will help alleviate the necessity of reloader gauntlets. Do I recommend foregoing it entirely? No but you can stack enough reload through your masterwork, Keep Away, and Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to not need it. Precision Instrument will be great as the reload will allow you to keep up high stacks. Headstone works will being a scout and a high-damage frame." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// The Slammer
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "New sword? I am pretty excited for the Slammer. Being a Zoom sword with some interesting combos means it will most likely find itself in my loadouts. Eager Edge will be great for most players, but if you’re looking for maximum damage I would recommend Relentless Strikes for ammo back. Chain Reaction and Thresh are also great options with some of the fourth column perks. Bait and Switch will be the best for pure damage, but Cold Steel for Stasis synergy and helping with champions might be a great play." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Judgment
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Judgment got an upgrade going from Kinetic to Stasis. While now it competes with the very dominant and popular Eyasluna, both being from a dungeon makes the competition also even. Headstone also being in the third column gives Judgment a huge edge. Being able to rock a damage perk and Headstone elevate Judgement past Eyasluna, however, Eyasluna is also able to get Unrelenting for better health. To each their own, but that is what makes Destiny so great." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// A Sudden Death
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A Sudden Death is not a great shotgun for PvE, while you do have Envious Assassin and One-Two Punch which together allow you to never worry about reloading, I find rapid-fire frames at the opposite end of the shotgun spectrum better for One-Two Punch. Trench Barrel and Grave Robber are great combinations for “maining” this shotgun but an even better combination would be Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace, the issue with this combo is that it’s a shotgun and not a primary ammo weapon." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Taraxippos
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We [probably] have a scout in our vault we use for PvE. Do we need another? Well technically no. Taraxippos doesn’t do anything another scout couldn’t do equally or better. If you somehow don’t have one, then yeah. Grind yourself one out this Guardian Games. It’s easy to get and you’ll probably have more than you know what to do with." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=106909392,1354429876,555281244,839105230

// The Title
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Void mains rejoice. I don’t think anyone is surprised to see this pick. Smallbore plus ricochet rounds boosts your stability and range enough to not worry about engagement ranges and compete with auto rifles. The extra overshield and add clearing capabilities will also allow you to allocate different fragments into your builds." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=655712834&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2048641572,776531651

// Tigerspite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Tigerspite is one of those guns that despite not having the best perks, the best stats, or even the best model; something about it feels phenomenal. I enjoy almost every Tigerspite I use, and I am excited to get more of them. Kinetic Tremors, Frenzy, or Kill Clip will depend on your activity and favorite damage boost. Pair it with your favorite reload or reload bypassing perk and you’ve got a dependable workhorse auto that just feels like bliss." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Twilight Oath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Similarly to Retold Tale, Twilight Oath has PvE perks but not the best position. Envious Assassin is great for overfilling the magazine, and Vorpal Weapon will net you great damage. You can utilize the full extent of Precision Instrument, my biggest issue is the frame. Rapid-fire frame snipers are hard to utilize at max RPM and require a hard pull down to keep on target. With the crit box shrinking on some bosses and champions doing what champions want to do, it will be hard to continuously hit crits at max RPM. Otherwise it’s a pretty solid general use sniper." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Vouchsafe returns but has lost a bit of its edge. It used to be a really good void scout, comparable to Night Watch. And while Night Watch has still kept some of its relevance over the years, Doom of Chelchis has overtaken Vouchsafe for the best in slot weapon. Vouchsafe does retain some great perks in Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload, while also adding in great perks like Repulsor Brace and Golden Tricorn. It might not be the ultimate best weapon, but it also doesn’t require any raiding." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Waking Vigil
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Let’s talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. While we still have some great perks going on currently, Waking Vigil is just a relic from the past." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sleepless
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Sleepless is an interesting rocket. It was great when rockets could be used everywhere and when we didn’t have to reload via Lunafaction Boots or Rally Barricades. Currently you’ll find very limited uses out of most rockets. There are a few options that have risen to the top, but it means most rockets are going to fall into general utility tools. Sleepless has Chain Reaction for better add clear, and Auto-Loading Holster for quality of life. You might be able to squeeze out some solid DPS with Field Prep but without a good damage perk you’ll fall behind almost immediately." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Being a stasis trace rifle already gives Appetence viability in a lot of loadouts. No longer are you tied to Ager’s Scepter for a “kinetic” trace rifle. Appetence is also legendary so you open up a plethora of loadout possibilities. In PvE you can make the most of this trace rifle with Overflow and Killing Tally for a 21% Delirium-lite. Being able to walk over bricks of special to double the magazine capacity keeps Killing Tally primed and ready to rip into any wave of enemy you might have in front of you. If you prefer a more calculated approach or don’t want to use just one weapon, Headstone is extremely strong with the buffed Stasis subclasses." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh hey, a new strand fusion rifle. Will Scatter Signal be better than Pressurized Precision? Well neither are great as Strand fusion rifles. But for a “Kinetic” fusion rifle I think Scatter Signal rivals and possibly beats out Riptide for best in slot fusion. Overflow and Controlled Burst for added damage throughout the magazine. You’ll only need one magazine booster to hit the fusion cap of 8 shots or you can opt for an even faster firing fusion with Accelerated Coils. Overflow will double your magazine capacity giving you 16 shots, 15 of which will have an extra 20% damage increase. If you opt for Extended Battery for the 16 total shots you can slot in Major or Boss spec for an additional 7.77% damage to every shot." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adhortative is an adaptive solar pulse rifle most similar to Forge’s Pledge. Adhortative has better range, handling, and recoil direction, while losing in stability, reload speed and airborne effectiveness. Either pulse is only better than the other by less than 3 points in each category, except for airborne effectiveness and recoil direction, 9 and 10 respectively. Between these two for PvE, Adhortative wins purely for having a reload perk in Feeding Frenzy. If you don’t care about that, either can work." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Lethophobia is defined as an abnormal anxiety of forgetting. Let’s hope you don’t forget the god rolls of this bow then. As with most PvE bows you’re looking for a good combination of draw time and accuracy. Successful Warm-Up gives you a better draw time post-defeat, but has a bit less utility against higher health enemies. Explosive Head can stagger those arrow sponges a bit easier but having Rapid Hit or Archer’s Tempo there would have been preferred. Disruption break will work best in conjunction with a high damage kinetic weapon like this season's Supercluster slug shotgun. Golden Tricorn will feel great on a combination of subclasses this season with Permeability changing this weapons damage type from void to your selected subclass. You can run a full void or full strand or stasis loadout without much thought. Just remember that the damage change goes away when you stow this weapon." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Precision frame hand cannons have not had their time in the spotlight for a while. Outside of the Seventh Seraph Officer’s Revolver paired with Lucky Pants there are not many reasons to use a precision frame hand cannon. If you run void subclasses a lot you can take advantage of Golden Tricorn to maximize damage, making these fast firing hand cannons feel way more chunky than they normally are. Rapid Hit will also bring up the already decent reload speed and their exceptional stability. If you feel like you need more range in PvE (which is an already odd thing to task for) you can opt for Keep Away for a continuous reload speed buff and a touch more range." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I hope that Scalar Potential lives up to its name. An arc rapid-fire frame Feels. Very. Familiar. Huh, I can’t place my thumb on it. Well, since we’ve never seen one of these before you’re going to want Overflow to double your magazine capacity, and Golden Tricorn to really pump up that damage. Arrowhead Brake is almost required for the low 53 recoil direction. With our new deterministic recoil you might be able to learn the recoil pattern and not need Arrowhead Brake, but I don’t like to fight with my weapons." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Subjunctive
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Subjunctive was the smg that could. It felt great in PvE and held its own back when recluse dominated all aspects of our life. Oh how naive we were. When Rampage and Outlaw were all we cared about. Things have shifted and more weapons are certainly popular. The only true competition Subjunctive needs to worry about is the Ikelos SMG. Both are arc, but what gives Subjunctive the edge? Golden Tricorn. It’s not the highest uptime on Arc but you can chain back to back arc ability kills with some loadouts, this will give Subjunctive a 1.5x damage bonus over the Ikelos (this is without giving the Ikelos a damage perk of its own). Most players spec’ed into Voltshot which will clear rooms easier but have slight difficulties taking down beefier targets. With Golden Tricorn 2x you’ll have enough damage to look at enemies and they’ll become unalive from sheer admiration, and you’ll be able to chunk down majors with ease, Subsistence just keeps the chains rolling." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Breakneck
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Breakneck returns to us in all its glory. Onslaught paired with Subsistence gives you the best of both worlds. A faster shot and Actium War Rig-lite. Feeding Frenzy is a nice second but you don’t want to stop firing to lose the damage buff. Onslaught itself also gives you a nice bonus to reload on its own. // Marcato-45
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "I’m happy to see more adaptive frame machine guns. None will ever replace our lord and savior Hammerhead. But we can think they’re still strong in our heart of hearts. Onslaught paired with Triple Tap could be really good for about 3 seconds. You will have to ramp up the kills with some smaller enemies, hoping not to waste too much ammo, and then unload into a major or boss with the added damage with the remainder of your magazine. In practice I don’t know how well it will be. Golden Tricorn can activate, reload, and then you can ramp up to the second level with a full magazine." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Belisarius-D is already making waves as one of the strongest pulse rifles with a ton of combinations. It might not be as good as pre-nerf No Time to Explain, but it certainly holds its own in our current Meta. Arrowhead isn’t necessary with our deterministic recoil, but I found the bursts a bit tighter and easier to control. I like that Vorpal Weapon can be paired with Kill Clip for extra damage against majors and champions. Rapid Hit is a better neutral perk for cleaning up the burst and adding much needed reload speed." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Retrofuturist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Retrofuturist is an interesting addition this season. Alongside Riiswalker we have a kinetic option for a lightweight frame shotgun. Retrofuturist was never a truly strong pick for PvE and that remains for this current version. Auto-Loading Holster will be your best quality of life perk, and paired with Vorpal Weapon is a very cookie-cutter shotgun. Destabilizing Rounds pairs best with Feeding Frenzy to use Retrofuturist as your primary add-clearing weapon." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Chivalric Fire
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Our full ritual playlist weapon is an interesting one. Caster frame swords have not been strong since their introduction. So Bungie is either testing us to see if they should buff caster frames or trying to get more hands on feedback. I feel like caster frames are a tough one to balance. Give them too much damage and they become an extremely safe pick in everyday play. Lower the ammo requirements and you will inadvertently buff their DPS as you’ll have more opportunities to use the heavy attack. Lower their charge time to counterbalance either of those changes and we’re back to square one. Chivalric Fire is a great neutral sword that works best on Void subclasses, but you can utilize either orb generation or volatility to great success without committing to Void." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=1749209109,243981275,52780822,938542991
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=243981275,52780822,776531651,938542991
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=1749209109,2048641572,52780822,938542991
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=2048641572,52780822,776531651,938542991

// Lethal Abundance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Lethal Abundance has one thing going for it, being a Strand high-impact frame auto rifle. Slice and Hatchling both give this weapon extra Strand utility, but on other subclasses this weapon feels like any generic high-impact auto rifle. Enlightened Action and Keep Away both bump up your reload speed, either organically or passively, respectively. Target Lock works best on beefier targets, but can also help on rank and file enemies. Hatchling works best when paired with Strand. Onslaught might be the best neutral perk, but if you want a faster firing auto rifle, just use any of the other Strand auto." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Riiswalker
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Riiswalker is an interesting weapon. A Fallen-forged weapon that can be used against the Fallen. Oh how the turns have tabled. Discord and Vorpal Weapon are going to be my top picks for keeping your magazine loaded and for extra damage against majors. It will not be better than more defined picks, but it will be strong in less focused strikes and low-end PvE." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Undercurrent
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Forbearance, Salvager’s Salvo, or Undercurrent. Which is going to reign supreme? Probably Forbearance. But Undercurrent is a decent attempt. Voltshot isn’t as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Bait and Switch is interesting for keeping up damage but not having a reliable magazine overflow perk hurts a bit more. Ambitious Assassin is great, but Envious is better. Overall I’d say it’s a neat addition but you wouldn’t be too hurt not having it if you already have Forbearance or Salvo." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Undercurrent (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Forbearance, Salvager’s Salvo, or Undercurrent. Which is going to reign supreme? Probably Forbearance. But Undercurrent is a decent attempt. Voltshot isn’t as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Bait and Switch is interesting for keeping up damage but not having a reliable magazine overflow perk hurts a bit more. Ambitious Assassin is great, but Envious is better. Overall I’d say it’s a neat addition but you wouldn’t be too hurt not having it if you already have Forbearance or Salvo." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Eye of Sol
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Here is a weapon that should not see much use in PvE. Unsurprisingly a PvP weapon is good in PvP, Eye of Sol returns but without Outlaw, Field Prep, or any real good reload perk. Nothing exists on Eye of Sol that will propel it to see any use in general PvE other than to practice for PvP. The best damage perk is either Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Precision Instrument is great but you’ll almost ever see the full benefits of it." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Incisor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn’t nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren’t perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Incisor (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn’t nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren’t perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Naeem's Lance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Naren’s Lance is an interesting weapon. It’s not quite dead on arrival, but it doesn’t do any one thing particularly well. Reconstruction and Precision Instrument are great paired with the rapid fire frame, allowing a ton of shots fired with increased damage. But then it falls in that it’s a rapid fire frame and firing at 140 RPM while maintaining full crits is extremely difficult." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Vengeful Whisper
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I’m happy for more variants of weapons. Vengeful Whisper being a strand bow opens up some loadout flexibility and covers your strand subclass verbs. It’s less useful without Match Game but it can still be useful for taking out shields faster. Archer’s Tempo is fantastic on bows for lowering successive draw times, and Precision Instrument fits nicely as you’ll want to hit those crits, the draw time allowing you a bit of forgiveness lining up those crit shots. You could even switch it up and go with Explosive Payload and Successful Warm-Up if you’re using this in lower and PvE where you can one shot everything to keep Successful Warm-Up going." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Indebted Kindness
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This sidearm is the reason why this breakdown took so long. I cannot wrap my head around it and it took me a while to get rolls I wanted to test. Beacon Rounds are incredible, it turns into a mini-tracking rocket. A beefier Dreg’s Promise if you remember. Impulse Amplifier gives you a near hit scan weapon. Voltshot turns Indebted Kindness into a pocket Trinity Ghoul with a beefier per shot damage profile." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Horror Story
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "So Horror Story is stasis now. Kinda cool, but not the biggest draw. The combo I'm looking for is Enlightened Action and Target Lock. The two of them together give you bonus handling, reload, and damage. As long as you're connecting shots you'll get the benefits of both!" Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Jurassic Green
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "It can roll Incandescent and Subsistence, but I think it shines with Golden Tricorn. // Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "In order to, in my humble opinion, get the most out of it in PvE, you'll want a base of 4 in your magazine. This way with Clown Cartridge there's a very high chance you'll be with 5 going into engagements. With Vorpal Weapon you won't need to hit crits in order to do good damage and you can take this solo without any drop in damage. Reload MW helps speed up those reloads getting you back to 4 or higher." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3871226707&perks=1087426260,1546637391,2284787283,839105230

// Acosmic GSp
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Similar to how Geodetic HSM is the best sword for void mains, Acosmic GSp will be the best grenade launcher for void mains. Loose Change is a laughable perk on its own, but coupled with Destabilizing Rounds you won't need to rely as heavily on your abilities to get a whopping +50 reload speed. You'll be able to clear rooms with ease and be able to bridge your loadout into higher DPS weapons." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=413901114&perks=1119449540,2048641572,3301904089,3525010810

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Warden's Law got a buff recently and allows it to feel more like a hybrid Crimson. // Malediction - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I've heard some incredible things about Malediction. Mostly that it feels like a 140 but hits like a 120. Enlightened Action is the best perk for 120s, it bumps up two of the lower stats of the archetypes; handling and reload. Explosive payload also bumps up the damage ever so slightly. Harmony and Discord work really well together to constantly have a full magazine and a damage bump for 7 seconds. You won't be able to keep up the damage bump, but the synergy is there." // Eleatic Principle - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am sure by now most players have a good rapid-fire machine gun in their arsenal. Whether that's Retrofit Escapade, Planck's Stride, Recurrent Impact, Shattered Cipher, or reaching all the way back even a Thermal Erosion. That being said, the only direct competition Eleatic Principle has is with Planck's Stride, which I think Eleatic Principle blows Planck's out of the water. Eleatic has access to Golden Tricorn which is the best damage perk in the game, or if you prefer not to use an arc subclass you could go with Target Lock for a slightly different Retrofit. You won't have access to a reload or mag extending perk but you can make the shots easier to land with Zen Moment, Well Rounded, or after some kills even Heating Up." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Persuader - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did anyone want more Rapid-Fire Frame snipers? I hope so because Persuader is here and ready to take up some vault space. The best PvE option is actually a throwback repeat to one of my first "DPS" snipers. Does anyone remember the Long Shadow with Rapid Hit and Triple Tap being the best we could have in Forsaken until Black Armory introduced us to Firing Line. Persuader is the best option for the older perk combo, but is still outclassed by other snipers in the current Sandbox. Supremacy and Praedyth's Revenge are both incredible for damage, and any Firing Line sniper will compete with this one for decent damage." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Deadpan Delivery - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Deadpan Delivery is a great shotgun for most players looking for a "plug and play" shotgun. Being able to have Overflow and One-Two Punch for the highest damage show followed by the most One-Two Punch... punches. The only other synergy you could have asked for is Grave Robber for instant refresh on melee kills. However, on bigger bosses that might need a few more hits than your magazine allows this could slot in perfectly. Being Arc it also has some synergy with the Hunter class and can play into blinding / amplified builds. Discord is another interesting shout as you can run around with Frenzy for full uptime on damage and always having ammo to shoot with. Barrel Constrictor is an interesting perk for PvE as it makes sure all your pellets hit but it would be better paired with One-Two Punch instead of in the same column." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Kept Confidence - PvE (pve,mkb,controller)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Kept Confidence is getting a lot of hype but is it worth it? We have some incredible powerhouses in the same slot. Fatebringer, Austringer, Eyasluna, Spare Rations, and to a lesser extent D.F.A. and Dire Promise. What does Kept Confidence bring to the table? Well, in PvE not a whole lot. If you're constantly cycling debuffs it could be interesting, but not all subclasses have equal access to debuffs. Void warlock and hunter could be the strongest uptime with child and the smoke bomb applying debuffs. Otherwise I think this perk is mostly useless. It then leaves us with a dilemma; what is the best PvE perk on Kept Confidence for PvE? Stats for All is probably going to be your best bet. It leaves a lot to be desired, but is the best we can do. Pairing this with Collective Action or Multikill Clip are going to be your best bets. There aren't a lot of good combinations for PvE with this hand cannon." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Nightshade - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Nightshade returns in its third, and hopefully, final glory. With a recoil direction of 56 you almost need Arrowhead Brake in order to fire at full RPM. In PvE I would highly recommend Flared Magwell or Light Mag depending on if you want range or stability. The added reload will feel incredible. You can then stack on Outlaw or Enlightened Action for better reload on top of that, or even Keep Away to bump out your range and handling. I find that in certain activities it is hard to keep enemies away all the time so you'll be constantly fighting whether the perk is up or not. Finally to round out the reload / damage perks you can use the easiest damage Nightshade has to offer, Collective Action. I find Kill Clip to be better as it's an ever so slightly higher damage bump. But depending on your build if you can create those elemental pickups it would be easier on Collective Action. Hatchling could work really well on Strand now that they received a slight buff." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// The Showrunner - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Showrunner returns to us in an interesting time. I know I will be using it but that's because it can roll with an ever so elusive combination of Grave Robber and Swashbuckler. The Showrunner being the second lightweight frame with this combo and the first in the Kinetic Slot. For me this works well with all my titan builds and my titan brain. However, if you're not on a punch subclass or the master class then opting for something like Overflow and Kinetic Tremors will be a great combo. Overflow allows you to get 72 bullets per magazine, allowing for a whopping 7 Kinetic Tremor activations; and that's just at base. The only other weapon to get this combination is Buzzard but the lower magazine on Buzzard really holds it back, only getting 3 per overflow. This doesn't mean you can't get more than that by constantly walking over bricks to refill the magazine, but let's be honest I haven't done that subconsciously and I love Overflow." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Brya's Love - PvE (pve,mkb,controller)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Brya's Love is probably the only weapon I will really grind out, and this is only for PvE. Brya's Love has some incredible perk combinations I would love to try out. Destabilizing Rounds on void has some incredible utility. Precision Instrument will probably take the cake as the next Vorpal Weapon being able to scale up damage with ease. Pair that with Rapid Hit to really get the most for your precision hits. Another great perk to craft would be Shoot to Loot to get your ammo and orbs from a distance. Not being required to chase after orbs is a pretty big benefit." Thanks to one of my Patrons, we discovered with one reserve mod and enhanced Bipod you can have 15 rockets in reserves. // Locus Locutus - PvE (pve,controller,mkb)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Locus Locutus is a very fun name, but does the weapon hold up as well as its vocalization? To save you some reading, not really. You can get some great usage in PvE with Overflow and Firing Line for some great damage but we already have a better version in Thoughtless. Thoughtless beats out every stat of Locus Locutus except for the airborne effectiveness stat. Locus Locutus has +2 at 4. So the only stat Locus Locutus beats Thoughtless in is a waste stat. Both can roll Overflow and Firing Line. Both can also get Headstone. Kill Clip is unique to Locus Locutus but you have to ask yourself if Kill Clip is worth it in PvE." // Abyss Defiant - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Abyss Defiant is a high-impact auto rifle with arguably better perks than Ammit. Ammit doesn’t have reliable reload perks but can definitely maintain great damage. Keeping all that damage, bumping it up a tad but slowing down the fire rate is Abyss Defiant’s main claim to fame (that was a mouthful). Reconstruction and Subsistence with your flavor of damage perk will give you a reliable auto rifle to completely destroy whatever is standing in your way. The combination of Heal Clip and Kill Clip is nice to see." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Oversoul Edict - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did anyone ask for more rapid-fire frame pulses? It wasn’t on my Bingo card. Either way Oversoul Edict is here and requires Arrowhead Brake in order to even shoot reliably. Even with Arrowhead and a Counterbalance Stock you’ll be just shy of perfect at 94 recoil direction. Definitely great, but it’s a shame you’ll have to sacrifice a mod to make it feel like it’s shooting where you point it. In PvE Oversoul Edict doesn’t have the best reload perks. Keep Away and Precision Instrument are both great, Demolitionist can be strong on grenade heavy builds. The reason why I want a good reload perk like Outlaw or Rapid Hit is because of Voltshot. Being able to clear rooms with Voltshot is becoming more and more fun, but having to reload to get the zaps is less fun." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Fang of Ir Yût - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Fang of Ir Yut is back and is the first Crota’s End weapon we will be talking about. It is a rapid-fire frame scout with some incredible perks. It might not be the strongest for PvP but for PvE we have some incredible perks. Rewind Rounds and Precision Instrument will keep your damage going and grant you extra bullets refunded. Rapid Hit also substitutes in here nicely as both perks require precision hits. Sword Logic is a new damage perk similar to Rampage or any other stackable buffs. Finally you can use this scout as a faster Taraxippus with Hatchling and Shoot to Loot to pick up orbs and ammo from a distance." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Song of Ir Yût - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I did not participate in the raid race, but this weapon was one of the first to reach my ears on being a potential monster. Bait and Switch can put out some incredible damage, and you get to pair it with either Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds, both will extend your magazine and allow you to keep the DPS going. If you prefer less weapon swapping I would go Target Lock to keep damage up and really lay into that boss. Sword Logic or Voltshot are both great at clearing rooms and your choice will depend on how you feel about reloading a machine gun." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Swordbreaker - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Swordbreaker is the returning shotgun from Crota’s End. Here we have a case of “interesting but not incredible.” Being able to get both Pugilist and One-Two Punch is a fantastic combo, but I feel that most people will opt for Subsistence to forget what reloading is like. Demolitionist is good for grenade heavy builds and also for forgetting the reload animation. In the final column, One-Two Punch is the best in slot, but on a Strand ability focused build you can get away with Golden Tricorn for even more damage. Sword Logic is also here if you want to run through enemies like Doom Guy and shotgun everything." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// A Distant Pull
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload Speed. Rapid-Fire Frame(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "A Distant Pull is an interesting sniper. Rapid-fire snipers aren’t meta but this one could be incredibly strong to keep within your vault. Collective Action is an incredibly useful buff as it can be applied on any subclass. Headstone gives you some great cover and add control, but I find it far less useful on a sniper. Triple Tap gives you some great utility against majors, bosses, or vehicles where you can continuously crit them. I don’t think this sniper will really shake up the meta, but it does offer some great utility on all classes. Jack of all trades, master of none." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Apex Predator
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Velocity. Adaptive Frame(20) Solar Rocket Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "Apex Predator is the best rocket launcher in the game. With enhanced Reconstruction you can almost always have a rocket ready to fire at any given time. With Explosive Light you get incredible amounts of damage and orbs are easy to make now. Bait and Switch is another great damage perk and does more damage, but I find Explosive Light easier to work with, especially with the new mod system revolving around orbs of power. Simple answer is, use Explosive Light if you’re lazy, if you’re trying to min-max use Bait and Switch." |tags:pve,mkb,controller
